Title: Recent Advances in the Use of Biochemical Sensors for Monitoring Biomarkers in Closed-Loop Neuromodulation Systems: A Systematic Review

Research Question: What are the recent developments in the use of biochemical sensors for monitoring biomarkers in closed-loop neuromodulation systems and their potential impact on patient outcomes?

Objective: The objective of this systematic review is to provide a comprehensive analysis of recent advances in the use of biochemical sensors for monitoring biomarkers in closed-loop neuromodulation systems. The review will explore the current state of the art in the development of biochemical sensors and their integration into closed-loop neuromodulation systems, as well as their potential clinical applications and impact on patient outcomes.

Paragraphs/Chapters:

I. Introduction

* Background and rationale for the review
* Definition of biochemical sensors, closed-loop neuromodulation systems, and their importance
* Research question and objectives of the review

II. Methodology

* Search strategy and databases used
* Inclusion and exclusion criteria
* Data extraction process and variables
* Quality assessment of the selected articles
* Analysis methods and data synthesis approach

III. Biochemical Sensors in Closed-Loop Neuromodulation Systems

* Overview of closed-loop neuromodulation systems
* Types of biochemical sensors used in closed-loop neuromodulation systems
* Biomarkers monitored using biochemical sensors in closed-loop neuromodulation systems
* Clinical applications of closed-loop neuromodulation systems using biochemical sensors

IV. Impact on Patient Outcomes

* Evidence on the impact of closed-loop neuromodulation systems on patient outcomes
* Potential benefits and limitations of using biochemical sensors in closed-loop neuromodulation systems

V. Discussion

* Summary of the main findings
* Potential clinical applications of closed-loop neuromodulation systems using biochemical sensors
* Implications for future research
* Limitations of the review

VI. Conclusion

* Summary of the main findings
* Significance of the study
* Concluding remarks

VII. References
